item.title: EU Referendum Briefing 6: The Impact on EU Employment and Equality Law Post-Brexit
item.description: Professor Steve Peers suggests that while some claim there would be a “bonfire of rights” if the UK left the EU, particularly in employment and equality, others argue that the EU has no bearing on these laws in the UK. This post will demonstrate that EU law has significantly improved employment and equality rights in the UK, especially for women in the workplace. A study of all UK cases reaching the EU court concerning these issues reveals that 60% of cases involving equal treatment for women resulted in findings that UK law was inadequate, leading to improved workplace protections for women.
